Biden voted against middle: class affordability for child care: The expert's verdict states that Biden voted against a proposal related to middle-class affordability for child care when he was a U.S. senator. This verifies the claim made by Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand.
Op: ed criticizing women working outside the home: The expert's verdict mentions that Biden wrote an op-ed expressing his belief that women working outside the home would create the deterioration of the family and avoid responsibility. This supports Gillibrand's claim about Biden's views on working mothers.
Biden: s op-ed criticizing the concept of both parents working: The expert's verdict mentions that Biden's op-ed criticized the idea of both parents working if it wasn't financially necessary. This further supports Gillibrand's claim about Biden's views on working mothers and his preference for one parent staying home if possible.
